Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT)

Electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) A safe and effective treatment for refractory depression, mania, and schizoaffective disorder. After around 5s, a 30s seizure usually occurs.

Excessive vagal activity causes bradycardia/asystole immediately following the shock. Then catecholamine release causes ↑MAP and ↑HR by 25%. Death rate (usually from MI/arrhythmia) around 1 in 100,000.
